definitions.definition: a utensil resembling a spoon, with a long handle and a deep bowl, used for removing powdered, granulated, or semisolid substances (such as ice cream) from a container.
examples: spoon, ladle, dipper; bailer a measuring scoop

definitions.definition: a short-handled deep shovel used for moving grain, coal, etc.
a moving bowl-shaped part of a digging machine, dredger, or other mechanism into which material is gathered.
a quantity taken up by a scoop.
examples: an apple pie with scoops of ice cream on top
synonyms: ball; informaldollop "a scoop of vanilla ice cream"

definitions.definition: a piece of news published by a newspaper or broadcast by a television or radio station in advance of its rivals.
examples: exclusive (story), inside story, exposé, revelation, information he got the scoop on the new CEO

definitions.definition: pick up and move (something) with a scoop.
examples: Philip began to scoop grain into his bag

definitions.definition: create (a hollow or hole) with or as if with a scoop.
examples: a hole was scooped out in the floor of the dwelling
synonyms: cut out More"a hole was scooped out in the floor"remove
scrape out "cut the tomatoes in half and scoop out the flesh"

definitions.definition: pick up (someone or something) in a swift, fluid movement.
examples: he laughed and scooped her up in his arms
synonyms: grab "she scooped up armfuls of clothes"

definitions.definition: publish a news story before (a rival reporter, newspaper, or radio or television station).
